title: Biden says he was 'expressing my outrage' but not making a policy change when he said Putin 'cannot remain in power' - CNN
content:
1. Biden says he was 'expressing my outrage' but not making a policy change when he said Putin 'cannot remain in power'  CNN
  2. Biden says his comment about Putin not remaining in power reflects moral outrage, not a policy change: Live Ukraine updates  USA TODAY
  3. Biden walks back Putin regime change comment that he made during speech in Poland  CBS News
  4. Opinion | Biden told the truth about Putin. But regime change is not a policy option.  The Washington Post
  5. Biden is a diplomatic liability. He’s playing into Putin’s hands  The Guardian
description: President Joe Biden reiterated on Monday that he was not announcing a change in US policy when he had said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "cannot remain in power" -- a remark that caught American and international officials off-guard, sending the White House into clean-up mode over the weekend.
